content.raw:
Yeah, I would vote in favor of removing these variables entirely. The only reason I didn't is because I wasn't sure if they were needed by CI for some reason.

I introduced `DISABLE_TEST_CONFIGURATION` so that users would be able to control the behavior of `ENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION` from a cmake gui if they wanted to, instead of it being a mystery variable hiding inside one of the scripts.

But really, I'm not sure what the point would be in choosing not to configure the tests, since it doesn't take very much time, and you can choose not to build the tests by simply not running ~~make test~~ `make tests`. Perhaps `ENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION` is an artifact from before we had a separate target for tests?
